snippet: The Wall Street firm, which lost 658 of its nearly 1,000 New York employees on Sept. 11, had accused the airline of negligence and demanded as much as $1.1 billion in damages.
abstract: Wall Street firm Cantor Fitzgerald agrees to settle a 2004 lawsuit against American Airlines and its insurers over Cantor’s business and property losses resulting from September 11 attack on the World Trade Center.
lead_paragraph: The Wall Street firm, which lost 658 of its nearly 1,000 New York employees on Sept. 11, had accused the airline of negligence and demanded as much as $1.1 billion in damages.

headline.main: Cantor Fitzgerald to Settle 9/11 Lawsuit Against American Airlines
headline.print_headline: Cantor Fitzgerald to Settle 9/11 Lawsuit Against Airline
